questions.question: What maintenance type fixes bugs and defects in software?
questions.explanation: Corrective Maintenance addresses errors, faults, and defects found in operational software.

questions.question: What maintenance adapts software to new environments?
questions.explanation: Adaptive Maintenance modifies software to work with new operating systems, hardware, or other environmental changes.

questions.question: What maintenance improves performance or adds enhancements?
questions.explanation: Perfective Maintenance enhances existing functionality and improves performance or maintainability.

questions.question: What maintenance prevents future problems proactively?
questions.explanation: Preventive Maintenance makes changes before problems occur to improve reliability and future maintainability.

questions.question: What system tracks and manages software defects?
questions.explanation: Bug Tracking Systems record, prioritize, and track the resolution of software defects.

questions.question: What describes outdated software still in active use?
questions.explanation: Legacy Systems are older software systems that remain operational but may be difficult to maintain.

questions.question: What process redesigns software to improve its structure?
questions.explanation: Re-engineering restructures existing software to improve quality while maintaining functionality.

questions.question: What analyzes existing code to understand its design?
questions.explanation: Reverse Engineering examines software to extract design information and understand functionality.

questions.question: What strategy gradually phases out software features?
questions.explanation: Deprecation marks features for future removal, giving users time to transition to alternatives.

questions.question: What cost accumulates from delayed refactoring and shortcuts?
questions.explanation: Technical Debt represents the future maintenance cost of quick fixes instead of proper solutions.
